sentences.sContent: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.sCn: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.sContent: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.sCn: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.sContent: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.sCn: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.sContent: ...despite an increase in the UK population and a subsequent rise in the number of households...
...There has been an increase in the number of travelers since the installation of the cable cars in 1990s...
...but you can increase the odds of it occurring...
...Burger King will start to sell Seattle's Best coffee to increase sales...
...Many fast-food companies now expect to increase their revenue by introducing higher-priced items...
...I believe we are going to continue to increase our share of the market...
...The increase of e-book sales will force the book business to make changes not seen...
...Ben said the shop has seen an increase in its overall sales due to the bike-share program...
...The number of obese people is expected to increase quickly in the next few decades...
...That's why historically we see an increase in romantic love as a basis for forming long-term relationships...

phrases.pCn: 增长百分率；增长的百分数

trans.tranOther: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth
